body:
It looks like DLC 2.2 installed. Do you still get any error when you try to run anything?
Note that you can run `conda list` in your env to see the versions of everything installed.

I've always found that the best way to update deeplabcut is to do a fresh install in a new environment. You can keep the old version around if you want, and then delete it when you can. That's the point of conda environments.

You can change the default name of your env when you create it, e.g. to create an env called `DLC22`:

```
conda env create -f DEEPLABCUT.yaml -n DLC22
```

The thing is after doing everything and then even doing the version check after restarting the kernel, it still says 2.2rc3. Is that the most recent then and I'm misreading the releases page? No other real errors outside of libraries failing to load however it did take a significantly long time to train the network and analyze without access to the GPU.
Any advice on getting rid of the CUDA libraries error?

This is my output. So you're right I'm updated but it seems I'm importing incorrectly then since the version is incorrect? And then the cudatoolkit is at 10.0.130 right now and I don't know what else to change it to to get rid of the error.

Are you doing this in Jupyter? You originally said ipython, but you just mentioned restarting the kernel. Make sure you select the correct kernel for the new env that has 2.2 installed. 

Also, it appears as though you have cuda 10 installed. Check the installation instructions for installing cuda 11.
Sorry I meant to say terminal; I'm doing it all through the anaconda terminal.

I am having the same issue. 
A fresh download of DLC in a new environment (deeplabcut.__version__ showing it is downloading the latest version) is not downloading cuda (checked with conda list). 
If i then 'conda install cudatoolkit=10.0', it will then appear in the conda list but I get the same error message as @SweetStripes74  and deeplabcut will not train using the GPU. 
(I am running as administrator)

When I update to the latest version of cudatoolkit (and this is reflected in conda list, and I have restarted machine), i get no error message when I 'import deeplabcut', but when I begin training I get the errors: 
```
2021-08-20 12:21:14.790087: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'cusolver64_11.dll'; dlerror: cusolver64_11.dll not found
2021-08-20 12:21:15.055092: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'cudnn64_8.dll'; dlerror: cudnn64_8.dll not found
2021-08-20 12:21:15.057411: W tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_device.cc:1835] Cannot dlopen some GPU libraries. Please make sure the missing libraries mentioned above are installed properly if you would like to use GPU. Follow the guide at https://www.tensorflow.org/install/gpu for how to download and setup the required libraries for your platform.
Skipping registering GPU devices...
```
and training begins without GPU

Sometimes on Windows it's necessary to run the following after installing deeplabcut:

`conda install -c conda-forge cudnn`

Also make sure you have CUDA 11+ installed with supported GPU drivers (for CUDA 11+ and tensorflow 2+)  BEFORE installing deeplabcut.

@Charlottewiltshire97, @SweetStripes74, do you face the same problem in a regular python session? Please try launching `python` rather than `ipython` and let me know. ipython may be the culprit (you could also run `which ipython` and `which python` in the terminal, and check whether they point to the same python installer).

@SweetStripes74 

In [2]: deeplabcut.__version__
Out[2]: '2.2rc3'

yes, unfortuantely, I made a mistake in the code and the version reported right now is wrong   but it is 2.2 ... we will roll up to 2.2.1 this week, and this annoying blunder on my part will go away!
@Charlottewiltshire97 conda install cudatoolkit=10.0 should not work with the latest DLC, as it needs CUDA 11.

My bad, I was under the impression CUDA 10 was used for DLC. Manually installing CUDA 11 worked and I am training with GPU with no error messages!
Thanks so much for all the help!
